0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Interstitial cystitis, chronic: instill 50 mL (50% solution) into bladder, allow to remain for 15 min; repeat at 14-day intervals until symptomatic relief attained

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: Safety and effectiveness in children not established

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Interstitial cystitis, chronic
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
Injection site extravasation

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• lactation
  • pregnancy
  • urinary tract malignancy
  • dimethyl sulfoxide can cause histamine release

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Garlic breath, Garlic taste
  • Renal:Chemical cystitis, Transient
  • Other:Abnormal body odor, Garlic-like, Pain following administration of agent (Moderate to Severe)
Serious
Immunologic:Anaphylactoid reaction (rare)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Mucosal-Local: The mechanism by which dimethyl sulfoxide produces anti-inflammatory effects in interstitial cystitis is not known.

2.title: Metabolism
2.mono: Mucosal-Local: Major Metabolites: dimethyl sulfone and dimethyl sulfide.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    do not inject IV or IM
  • Intravesical
    instill 50 mL into bladder via catheter or asepto syringe and wait 15 minutes until voiding

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• symptomatic improvement
  • ophthalmic exam
  • hepatic function, renal function, CBC; every 6 mo

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause a garlic taste that can last for a few hours and a garlic odor to the breath/body that may persist up to 72 h after drug administration.
  • Drug may also cause pain or discomfort upon instillation; however, this usually lessens with repeated administration.
